Articles.Content:
Remember where some parts would break into multiple pieces (solar panels, antennas) once they were destroyed? It’d be cool for KSP2 to expand on that.

Of course not every part is gonna be destructible, but it’d be nice to see landing gear, the procedural wings, and some engines be able to fall apart.
Fuel tanks could bend and crumple like a crushed soda can... Non-explosive contents (methane in non-oxygen atmospheres counts for this!) could leak or spray out!

flying pieces of metal or anything if the rocket blows up. 

also add some screaming from far away...

3 hours ago, zemiel123 said:

flying pieces of metal or anything if the rocket blows up. 

also add some screaming from far away...

Wow, that's some dark stuff, it probably won't happen to let the game be rated E.

I think i posted an idea once for more detailed kerbal injuries, never thought of having them scream though...

Don't they already panic when the craft undergoes dramatic LOC?

Also more detailed explosions. Having a fire with a pillar of smoke after you crash would be a nice detail.

And shockwaves. If I crash my giant 3000 part ship I want everyone within the span of 50 km to know.

7 hours ago, OrdinaryKerman said:

I think i posted an idea once for more detailed kerbal injuries, never thought of having them scream though...

Don't they already panic when the craft undergoes dramatic LOC?

I don’t think they’d be able to add kerbal injuries due to the fact that at the speeds they’ll be going, hitting anything would cause them to turn into a green mist and multiple green body parts. The devs may not want to push the rating. It would be funny to have the kerbals scream though.
Then we get to hear there screams for help…
But... and I'm glad no one thought to make this joke yet...   in space... no one can hear you scream.

2 minutes ago, CiberX15 said:

But... and I'm glad no one thought to make this joke yet...   in space... no one can hear you scream.

I know this is a joke, but we can still hear them over the radio

Edited June 11, 2023 by OrdinaryKerman
spelig

7 minutes ago, OrdinaryKerman said:

I know this is a joke, but we can still hear them over the radio

I mean... yeah... And actually I'm not opposed to hearing them yell in terror. They already show fear or excitement, so adding some audio cues based on those same triggers would be kind of funny. 

Like a few people have already said, screams of pain on impact might be a bit much for an E for everyone rating, but fear or excitement aught to be fine? On the other hand, would such sounds be distracting or annoying? But if they are, an option could be added to disable it just like the launch countdown. A feature that I will likely never turn off, and yet am glad is an option.
funny thing though, all the explosions drown out the screams. at least you can absorb the looks of horror on their faces.
